questions.question_text: Which two are true about lexical units? (Choose two.)

choices.E: All user-defined identifiers must start with an alphabet.
choices.D: A character literal with zero characters has the BOOLEAN value NULL.
choices.B: Spaces can be embedded in delimiters.

questions.question_text: Which three are true regarding code based access control (CBAC)? (Choose three.)

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: AFG
no body has answer for this question. Admin do your job and post correct answers please.

Selected Answer: BCF
I think it's B+C+F

https://docs.oracle.com/en/database/oracle/oracle-database/19/dbseg/managing-security-for-definers-rights-and-invokers-rights.html#GUID-D7E76448-152C-4207-9D48-FE562E0D911C

comments.content:
In the file is written CAN and not CANNOT: 
'Code based access control CAN be used to secure definer’s rights.'
G is wrong.

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: BCF
I think it's B+C+G

https://docs.oracle.com/en/database/oracle/oracle-database/19/dbseg/managing-security-for-definers-rights-and-invokers-rights.html#GUID-D7E76448-152C-4207-9D48-FE562E0D911C

choices.F: You can use CBAC to attach database roles to a PL/SQL function, procedure, or package.
choices.B: CBAC roles can be granted to a program unit only if they are directly granted to its owner.
choices.E: In CBAC, the ADMIN and DELEGATE options cannot both be granted to the same user.
choices.A: In a multitenant environment, the DELEGATE option of CBAC cannot be used.
choices.C: CBAC roles can be granted to a program unit only if they are the predefined roles automatically defined by the standard scripts as part of database creation.
choices.G: CBAC cannot be used to secure definer's rights.
choices.D: You can use CBAC to attach database roles to a PL/SQL function or procedure only.

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: B
B because exception raised in declarative section must be handle in a superior bloc

Selected Answer: B
Tested - B.

Error means successful message from the exception
C is wrong because negative error code should be in the range -20000 .. -20999

Selected Answer: B
B is correct 
But C gives the same result

comments.content: No, C does not give the same result. Not only it (re)named ORA-02001: user SYS is not permitted to create indexes with freelist groups, but also is out of scope for outer exception handler.

questions.question_text: Which block of code displays the error message “Incorrect price value”?

choices.A: The lock acquired when executing the OPEN c1 command will be released only after a COMMIT or ROLLBACK statement is issued.
choices.E: An OPEN c1 command will acquire a lock only on the PRICE column in the PRODUCTS table.
choices.B: Only the PRICE column can be updated in the PRODUCTS table.
choices.D: The WHERE CURRENT OF clause can be used only if the FOR UPDATE clause is used in the cursor definition.
choices.C: The FOR UPDATE OF clause can be used only if the WHERE CURRENT OF clause is used in the executable part of the block.

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: AD
A - The lock acquired by the FOR UPDATE clause is released when the cursor is closed, not necessarily after a COMMIT or ROLLBACK. However, issuing a COMMIT or ROLLBACK will also release the lock. 
INTERVIEWSANSAR.COM

D The WHERE CURRENT OF clause is used in conjunction with a cursor that has been declared with the FOR UPDATE clause. It allows you to perform updates or deletes on the current row fetched by the cursor.

choices.E: Named subprograms are stored in the database server.
choices.C: A FUNCTION subprogram must return one or more values.
choices.A: Named subprograms cannot be called from other packages.
choices.F: Anonymous blocks must always start with the Declare keyword.
choices.G: FUNCTION subprograms must be called and passed through one or more parameters.
choices.D: Anonymous blocks cannot use packaged variables.

questions.question_text: Which three are true about anonymous blocks and subprograms? (Choose three.)

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: BCE
B C AND E

comments.content: A function cant return one or more value tho can it?
function CAN return multiple values through OUT or INOUT parameters (like procedure)

BCE IS TRUE
